bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler and Albert G. Love, November 19, 1952

div1.p: Hench writes that he will represent the Mayo Foundation at the Camp Lazear dedication. He discusses which groups should present wreaths at the dedication. He has just heard from Nogueira that the park is still called "Camp Lazear" and that Building No. 1 will also retain its name.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler and Albert G. Love, November 19, 1952
div1.opener:
November 19, 1952
Colonel J. F. Siler
President, Walter Reed Memorial Association
General Albert G. Love, Secretary
Walter Reed Memorial Association
Dear Friends:
div1.p:
General Paul Streit will attend the ceremonies at Camp Lazear on December 3.
I will officially represent the Mayo Foundation. The Mayo Foundation wishes
to express its sympathetic appreciation of the Cuban Government's action
and has authorized me to lay a wreath beneath the medallion of Doctor Finlay
on this occasion. I have informally suggested to General Streit that it
would be a fine gesture if he were authorized to place wreaths in homage
of Finlay and of Reed, especially of Finlay, for reasons which you can ap-
preciate.

Now I wonder if one of these wreaths which General Streit might lay should
not come from the Walter Reed Memorial Association or do you think the As-
sociation should place two wreaths? Would it be possible for you to tele-
phone General Streit and ask him about this whole matter?

I have written Doctor Nogueira, informing him of the desires of the Mayo
Foundation to honor Doctor Finlay in this manner and asking him and his
colleagues to consider at what appropriate time, either just before or
preferably during the ceremonies, these wreaths could be placed.

I think this is particularly appropriate if what I have heard this morning
from Doctor Nogueira is allowed to stand. He writes me “the park still is
Camp Lazear and Building #1 will keep its name. That is the thinking of
the patrons up to now.” You will recall that I had hoped that the park
would be named not Parque Finlay but would retain the name Camp Lazear.
In any event, I do think that the Walter Reed Memorial Association should
participate somehow in this ceremony and if the Association prefers to send
a telegraphic message rather than a wreath, this could be sent to Dr. Jose
Andreu, El Ministro de Salubridad y Asistencia Social, or to one of his
agents in this matter, Dr. Pedro Nogueira, Marti 219, Marianao, Havana, or
Dr. Cesar Rodriguez Exposito, Secretary, Marti 219, Marianao, Havana.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Copy to General Streit
